unify_key_modifiers.description: Whether to treat key modifiers like `LWin` and `RWin` as the same key modifier. Defaults to `true`.

entries.description: Filters to apply to windows to determine whether they should be managed by Whim
Routers to determine which workspace a window should be placed in

routing_behavior.description: The behavior to use when routing windows to workspaces

gaps.description: Plugin to add gaps between windows

command_palette.description: Plugin to add a command palette

command.description: The identifier of the command to run. For more, see https://dalyisaac.github.io/Whim/docs/customize/commands.html

keybind.description: The keybind to trigger the command. For more, see https://dalyisaac.github.io/Whim/docs/customize/keybinds.html

anyOf.description: Ignores windows with the specified window class
Ignores windows with the specified process file name
Ignores windows with the specified title
Ignores windows with a title that matches the specified regex
Routes windows with the specified window class to the specified workspace
Routes windows with the specified process file name to the specified workspace
Routes windows with the specified title to the specified workspace
Routes windows with a title that matches the specified regex to the specified workspace
Routes windows to the workspace that the window was launched on by Windows.
Routes windows to the workspace which last received an event sent by Windows.
Routes windows to the workspace which last received an event sent by Windows which Whim did not ignore.

WindowBackdropConfig.description: WinUI supports different backdrops/materials, depending on the OS version. To see the different materials available, see <see href='https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/apps/design/signature-experiences/materials'/>. The different materials support differing levels and style of transparency. This config lets you specify which backdrop to use for a given Whim window.

anyOf.description: A more transparent Acrylic backdrop - based on the Acrylic backdrop.
Mica backdrop - see <see href='https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/apps/design/style/mica'/>. Unsupported on Windows 10 - Whim will fall back to Acrylic.
A Mica variant which looks different to Mica - see <see href='https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/apps/design/style/mica'/>. Unsupported on Windows 10 - Whim will fall back to Acrylic.

always_show_backdrop.description: By default, WinUI will disable the backdrop when the window loses focus. Whim overrides this setting. Set this to false to disable the backdrop when the window loses focus.

GapsPlugin.description: Plugin to add gaps between windows. For more, see https://dalyisaac.github.io/Whim/docs/plugins/gaps.html

outer_gap.description: The gap between the parent layout engine and the area where windows are placed

default_outer_delta.description: The default outer gap used by commands `gaps.outer.increase` and `gaps.outer.decrease`

default_inner_delta.description: The default inner gap used by commands `gaps.inner.increase` and `gaps.inner.decrease`

CommandPalettePlugin.description: Plugin to add a command palette. For more, see https://dalyisaac.github.io/Whim/docs/plugins/command-palette.html

max_height_percent.description: The maximum height of the command palette as a percentage of the monitor height

max_width_pixels.description: The maximum width of the command palette in pixels

y_position_percent.description: The y position of the command palette as a percentage of the monitor height

backdrop.description: The backdrop to use for the command palette
